author: Anil Kumar Sastry
text:
Najmul Huda (25), a diploma holder in polymer technology, who was arrested by NIA personnel in Mangaluru on Friday on charges of spreading the Islamic State ideology, was said to be asking contacts “how to procure things”.

Najmul, an engineering dropout, was detained from his father Saiful Huda’s residence at Permude village, off Bajpe, in a pre-dawn operation by the NIA assisted by the Mangaluru city police.

Sources in the Mangaluru police said the NIA had registered a case in December following a report from the Home Affairs Ministry about the growing tendency among youths of spreading the IS ideology under different names.

Thereafter, the investigating agency began filtering the Internet and zeroed in on several suspects, including Najmul.
title: Najmul Huda was ‘procuring things’
